_header: Man behold and thou might hear / Thing full needful for to lere
Note:
Part of the ‘Continuation’ of Handlyng Synne (1283), for which see Sullivan (1978)
XSullivan, S. A. “Handlyng Synne in Its Tradition: A Study of Robert Mannyng of Brunne’s Handlyng Synne and Its Relation to Other Instructional Works, in Order to Establish the Place of the Poem in Its Genre.” Diss. Cambridge, 1978. Other sections are 378, 1598, 3099, 3355, 3358.
Subjects: The Seven Principal Virtues; virtues, seven principal
_description: The Seven Principal Virtues — 198 lines in couplets

CULIi49.First Lines:
Man be helde & thu may herethyng þat nedful is to
                    lere…
CULIi49.Last Lines:
…Cryst ȝeue vs grace to kepe hem ȝeuenÞat we
                    mown come to þe blysse of heuen

BLHar3954.First Lines: Man begold þ þu myth hereThyng ful nedful for to lere…
BLHar3954.Last Lines: …Cryst ȝyf vs grace so hem to ȝeueneþat we moun onlyn þe blys of heuene
BLHar3954.Attributed Title: Iste sunt vii virtutes Principales (rubric, f. 85va); Expliciunt vii virtutes (rubric, f. 86vb)
